N Gram Text Generation

src

This script generates random strings by sampling N-grams from a corpus of example text. An N-gram is a chunk of text composed of N tokens. In this simple example, the input corpus is split by whitespace. A token is any substring of the corpus that's left over after we split by whitespace. Strings are generated by initializing a list of tokens with a random N-gram. Then, we repeatedly examine the N-1 most recently added tokens. These tokens provide a "context" with which we search for next possible tokens to add to the string. To do this, we scan the existing set of N-grams to find all those that start with the context tokens. Then, a random token is selected from this pool of candidate tokens, and added to the list of tokens. This process is repeated until the list hits a set length, or when the pool of candidate tokens is of size 0.


The current version is... not optimized. Ideally, the ngrams would be stored in a map with contexts as keys, and lists of tokens as values, so one could quickly build the sampled text w.o having to rescan the entire set of ngrams to find matches.
